intro: Veronicastrum formosanum, commonly known as the Chinese blueweed, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and marshes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Veronicastrum formosanum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
